item.title: Training Language Models to Follow Instructions With Human Feedback (2022)
item.description: Increasing the number of parameters does not inherently improve a modelâ€™s ability to follow users’ intent. Large Language Models (LLMs) are typically trained to predict the next token in large-scale internet text corpora, but this objective does not explicitly encourage models to follow user instructions in a helpful and safe manner. [Training Language Models to Follow Instructions with Human Feedback](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2203.02155 introduces a method for aligning models with human intent using Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF).
